snippet: A new report from a United Nations agency raises concerns that the displacement of families is on the rise in the face of armed conflicts, political violence and other factors.
abstract: Editorial on United Nations report showing that some 42.5 million vulnerable people were displaced from their homes in 2011; asserts that numbers are likely to continue rising in face of global armed conflicts and political violence; urges the international community to develop better systems for predicting and responding to crises and to do a better job of pre-empting conflicts in the first place.
lead_paragraph: A new report from a United Nations agency raises concerns that the displacement of families is on the rise in the face of armed conflicts, political violence and other factors.
